metadata.title: [EXPERIMENTAL] FedRAMP Extensions [DRAFT]

revisions.remarks: Partial update to include some SAP, SAR, and POA&M extensions.
Revised draft to better align with OSCAL RC-1 SSP syntax.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this content.

parties.name:
Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management
            Office
parties.remarks:
This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.

The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-pmo\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

metadata.remarks:
This EXPERIMENTAL and DRAFT file exteneds OSCAL to meet FedRAMP requirements.

It provides the extensions, defined identifiers, and acceptable values in a machine-readable format necssary to meet FedRAMP Authorization Package requirements.

response-point.description: A property whose presence indicates its parent part is a required point of response for FedRAMP stakeholders.
response-point.remarks:
This appears in FedRAMP profiles and resolved profile catalogs.

For control statements, it signals to the CSP which statements require a response in the SSP.

For control objectives, it signals to the assessor which control objectives must appear in the assessment results, which aligns with the FedRAMP test case workbook.

revision-history-party-uuid.description: Identifies the party who authored this revision.

index-has-keys.name: index-local-party-uuid
index-has-keys.remarks: On the revision element in the revision history, the party-uuid extension must match the UUID of an existing party in the metadata.

iso-iec-17020-identifier.description: The ISO/IEC-17020 identifier assigned to the assessor related to their status as an A2LA Accredidted Third Party Assessment Organization.

CORE.description: Identifies a control that must be included in every FedRAMP assessment.
CORE.remarks: Core controls must be assessed every year, and are often subject to additional scrutiny by assessors and adjudication reviewers.

security-cia-level.description: The overall electronic authentication (eAuth) level applied to the system.

enums.label: Level 1 (Low)
enums.RICHTEXT: The overall eAuth Level is defined as Level 1 (Low).

enums.label: Level 2 (Moderate)
enums.RICHTEXT: The overall eAuth Level is defined as Level 2 (Moderate).

enums.label: Level 3 (High)
enums.RICHTEXT: The overall eAuth Level is defined as Level 3 (High).

security-cia-level.remarks: FedRAMP requires all Low systems to be at Level 1

enums.label: JAB P-ATO
enums.RICHTEXT: A FedRAMP Joint Authorization Board (JAB) Provisional-Authorization to Operate (P-ATO).

enums.label: Agency ATO
enums.RICHTEXT: A FedRAMP Agency Authorization to Operate (ATO).

enums.label: Tailored (LI-SaaS) ATO
enums.RICHTEXT: A FedRAMP Tailored authorization to operate (ATO) for low impact Software as a Service (LI-SaaS) systems.

users-internal.description: The current number of users internal to the organization.

users-external.description: The current number of users external to the organization.

users-internal-future.description: The anticipated number of users internal to the organization in one year.

users-external-future.description: The anticipated number of users external to the organization in one year.

privacy-designation.description: Indicates whether this system is privacy sensitive.

privacy-threshold-analysis-q1.description: Does the ISA collect, maintain, or share PII in any identifiable form?

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: Yes, the ISA collects, maintains, or shares some form of PII.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: No, the ISA does not collect, maintain, or share PII in any form.

privacy-threshold-analysis-q2.description: Does the ISA collect, maintain, or share PII from or about the public?

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: Yes, the ISA collects, maintains, or shares PII from or about the public.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: No, the ISA does not collect, maintain, or share PII from or about the public.

privacy-threshold-analysis-q3.description: Has a Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) ever been performed for the ISA?

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: Yes, a PIA has been performed.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: No, a PIA has not been performed..

privacy-threshold-analysis-q4.description: Is there a Privacy Act System of Records Notice (SORN) for this ISA system?

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: Yes, there is a SORN ID for this system.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: No, there is not a SORN ID for this system.

sorn-id.description: An assigned System of Records Notice (SORN) identifier for this system.

user-sensitivity-level.description: Defines the sensitivity level of the identified user type.

enums.label: High Risk
enums.RICHTEXT: Misuse of the user's access could result in grave damage to the public's trust.

enums.label: Severe
enums.RICHTEXT: Misuse of the user's access could result in a substantial degree of harm or serious damage to the public’s trust.

enums.label: Moderate
enums.RICHTEXT: Misuse of the user's access could result in a fair amount of harm or serious damage to the public’s trust.

enums.label: Limited
enums.RICHTEXT: Misuse of the user's access could result in some harm or discernible damage to the public’s trust.

enums.label: Not Applicable
enums.RICHTEXT: The user does not have access to the system.

user-sensitivity-level.remarks:
Values are as required by FedRMAP for packages based on NIST 800-53, Revision 4.

Authoritative source: [OPM Position Designation (Page 18)](#871713A8-5A27-4AC3-8B94-972588469C6B).

service-processor.description: Name of the interconnection service processor.

information.description: Describes the information transmitted over the interconnection.

interconnection-direction.description: Identifies the direction of information flow for the interconnection.

interconnection-security.description: Identifies the type of security applied to the interconnection.

port.description: A port used by the interconnection for the communication.

inventory-item-state.formal-name: Different states of inventory items: public, private, et cetera.
inventory-item-state.description: Indicates if the asset is virtual.

circuit.description: A circuit used for the communication.

connection-security.description: Identifies the mechanisms/protocol(s) used to secure the communication.

scan-type.description: Identifies the type(s) of scans to be performed on this inventory-item or component.

enums.label: Infrastructure
enums.RICHTEXT: The component or inventory item is included in operating system (OS) and/or infrastructure scans.

enums.label: Database
enums.RICHTEXT: The component or inventory item is included in Database scans.

enums.label: Web
enums.RICHTEXT: The component or inventory item is included in Web interface/application scans.

enums.label: Other
enums.RICHTEXT: The component or inventory item is included in non-typical scans.

planned-completion-date.description: Provides the date the control expects to be implemented. Must be present when Implementation Status is "Planned"

authorization-recommendation.description: Indicates whether the assessor recommends the system be authorized by the authorizing official.

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: Yes, the assessor recommends the system for authorization.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: No, the assessor does not recommend the system for authorization.

title-short.description: The short name for the system represented in the resource.

system-id.description: The FedRAMP-assigned identifier for this system.

import-profile.description: The baseline/profile for this sysytem based on its FIPS-199 categorization.

authorization-date.description: The date the system was authorized. Omit or leave blank for an initial authorization.

description.description: A brief description of the system.

sampling.description: Indicates whether a sampling methodology was used instead of assessing the entire system.

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: Yes, a sampling methodology was used.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: No, a sampling methodology was not used.

control-objective-implementation-status.description: Indicates the implementation status of the control objective.

enums.label: Implemented
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds sufficient evidence to agree the control objective is fully implemented.

enums.label: Partial
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds evidence to suggest a portion of the control objective is implemented and a portion is not.

enums.label: Planned
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds this control objective is not implemented, but there is evidence the system owner has a plan for implemnting it.

enums.label: Alternative Implementation
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds evidence of an alternative implementation, which the assessor judges to provide protection similar enough to satisfy this control.

enums.label: Not Applicable (N/A)
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds this control objective does not apply to this system.

control-implementation-status.description: Indicates the implementation status of the control.

constraint.remarks: When an prop is defined as an extension, a separate constraint assembly is needed to specify datatype and allowed values on the `@value` flag.

leveraged-authorization.description: Indicates a leveraged authorization used for this control.
leveraged-authorization.remarks: This is for legacy SSP convertion to OSCAL. The preferred approach is to specificy the leveraged system as a `component` and reference it in the control using `by-component`.

control-origination.description: The point(s) from which the control satisfaction originates.

constraint.remarks: When an prop is defined as an extension, a separate constraint assembly is needed to specify datatype and allowed values on the `@value` flag.

no-oscal-ssp-title-short.description: The abbreviated name for the system, such as an acronym.

no-oscal-ssp-import-profile.remarks: As with all URIs in OSCAL, this may contain a URI fragment, which identifies the local resource containing the relevant profile.

no-oscal-ssp-authorization-date.description: The date of the system's initial FedRAMP authorization.

task-login-url.description: The login URL for a web application.

task-login-id.description: The login ID used to assess the web application.

task-test-type.description: Indicates the type of test represented by the task.

enums.label: Web Application
enums.RICHTEXT: This task tests a web application.

task-user-uuid.description: Cites the SSP defined user role to use for testing.

poam-id.description: A CSP-assigned identifier for this POA&M item.

poam-impacted-control.description: A control impacted by this POA&M item.
poam-impacted-control.remarks:
Impacted control is required in the POA&M and optional in the SAR.

It is allowed in the SAR in anticipation of duplicatng open risks from the SAR to the POA&M.

sar-risk-priority.description: Assessor's recommended risk priority. Lower numbers are higher priority. One (1) is highest priority.

sar-recommend-authorization.description: Indicates the assessor's reommendation for initial or continued authorization.

enums.label: Yes
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor recommends initial or continued authorization.

enums.label: No
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor does not recommend initial or continued authorization.

operational-requirement.description: The risk cannot be remediated without impact to the system and must be accepted.

enums.label: Investigating
enums.RICHTEXT: A possible operational requirement is being investigated.

enums.label: Tracking
enums.RICHTEXT: An operational requirement deviation request was submitted to the AO and is pending adjudication.

enums.label: Approved
enums.RICHTEXT: The operational requirement has been approved by the AO.

false-positive.description: The risk was found to be a false positive report.

enums.label: Investigating
enums.RICHTEXT: A possible risk adjustment is being investigated.

enums.label: Tracking
enums.RICHTEXT: A false positive deviation request was submitted to the AO and is pending adjudication.

enums.label: Approved
enums.RICHTEXT: The false positive has been approved by the AO.

risk-adjustment.description: Mitigating factors were identified or implemented, reducing the likelihood or impact of the risk.

enums.label: Investigating
enums.RICHTEXT: A possible risk adjustment is being investigated.

enums.label: Tracking
enums.RICHTEXT: A risk adjustment deviation request was submitted to the AO and is pending adjudication.

enums.label: Approved
enums.RICHTEXT: The risk adjustment has been approved by the AO.

vendor-dependency.description: A vendor resolution is pending, but not yet available.

enums.label: Investigating
enums.RICHTEXT: The risk is a suspected vendor dependency, and is being investigated for verification.

enums.label: Tracking
enums.RICHTEXT: The vendor has confirmed the issue and is working on a resolution.

enums.label: Resolved
enums.RICHTEXT: The vendor released the fix and it has been applied.

constraints.name: observation-types
constraints.description: In addition to the NIST observation types, FedRAMP requires observaton types to support risk deviations and vendor dependencies.

enums.label: Vendor Dependency
enums.RICHTEXT: The observation provides evidence of reliance on a vendor for a pending resolution that is not yet available.

enums.label: False Positive
enums.RICHTEXT: The observation provides evidence the associated risk is a false positive finding.

enums.label: Operational Requirement
enums.RICHTEXT: The observation provides evidence to substantiate the assertion that remediating the risk will have an adverse impact on the system.

enums.label: Risk Adjustment
enums.RICHTEXT: The observation provides evidence to justify an adjustment to the likelihood or impact values.

enums.label: Closure
enums.RICHTEXT: The observation provides evidence of risk closure.

constraints.name: sar-risk-impacted-control
constraints.description: The impacted control field is optional in the SAR, but helpful in anticipation of copying open risks to the POA&M.

constraints.name: poam-risk-impacted-control
constraints.description: At least one impacted control field is required in the POA&M.

constraints.name: control-origination-constraints
constraints.description: The point(s) from which the control satisfaction originates.

constraints.name: control-implementation-status-constraints
constraints.description: Defines the data type and allowed values for the Control Implementation Status

enums.label: Implemented
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds sufficient evidence to agree the control objective is fully implemented.

enums.label: Partial
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds evidence to suggest a portion of the control objective is implemented and a portion is not.

enums.label: Planned
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds this control objective is not implemented, but there is evidence the system owner has a plan for implemnting it.

enums.label: Alternative Implementation
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds evidence of an alternative implementation, which the assessor judges to provide protection similar enough to satisfy this control.

enums.label: Not Applicable (N/A)
enums.RICHTEXT: The assessor finds this control objective does not apply to this system.

constraints.remarks: When an extension is an prop, the data type and allowed values must be defined in a separate constraint.

constraints.description: Remarks are required for certain Control Implementation Status values.

constraints.name: planned-completion-date
constraints.description: If the control implementation status is "Planned" a "Planned Implementation Date" must be provided.
constraints.remarks: In the SSP, if `implemented-requirement` includes `prop[@name='implementation-status']` with `value='planned'`, a `planned-completion-date` extension must be provided.

constraints.description: If a port number is provided as part of an interconnection, Local or Remote must be specified.
constraints.remarks:
The port field is a FedRAMP extension - a property assigned to a component with a component type of 'interconnection'.

When this extension is present, it must include a `@class` flag with a value of either 'local' or 'remote'.

constraints.description: If a port number is provided as part of an interconnection, Local or Remote must be specified.

enums.label: Local
enums.RICHTEXT: The identified port number is used by the interconnected system to communicate with this system.

enums.label: Remote
enums.RICHTEXT: The identified poart number is used by this system to communicate with the interconnected system.

constraints.remarks:
The port field is a FedRAMP extension - a property assigned to a component with a component type of 'interconnection'.

When this extension is present, it must include a `@class` flag with a value of either 'local' or 'remote'.

constraints.description: Identifies additional component types for Assessment Assets in the SAP and SAR.

enums.label: Assessment Origination
enums.RICHTEXT: The component identifies one or more IP addresses from which assessment activities may be performed.

constraints.remarks:
For FedRAMP, the SAP must identify the IP addresses from which scanning and penetration test activities are performed, and the SAR must identify the actual IP addresses used.

This requires an additional component type in the SAP's `assessment-assets`, and in the SAR's `result`, `local-definitions`, `assessment-assets`.

constraints.name: fedramp-general-role-identifiers
constraints.remarks: These are in addition to the NIST-defined allowed values for role identifiers, and apply to all OSCAL-based FedRAMP content.

constraints.name: fedramp-assessment-role-identifiers

enums.label: CSP Assessment PoC
enums.RICHTEXT: Cloud Service Provider Assessment Point(s) of Contact

enums.label: CSP End of Testing PoC
enums.RICHTEXT: Cloud Service Provider End of Testing Point(s) of Contact

enums.label: CSP Results PoC
enums.RICHTEXT: Cloud Service Provider Point(s) of Contact

constraints.remarks: These are in addition to the NIST-defined allowed values for role identifiers, and apply to OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAP and SAR content.

constraints.name: hash-algorithm
constraints.description: Identifies the algorithm used to create the hash value of the attachment.

constraints.name: attachment-type
constraints.remarks: These are in addition to the NIST-defined allowed values for resource types.

constraints.name: media-type
constraints.description: IANA media-types supported by FedRAMP as attachment/resource types.
constraints.remarks: These are in addition to the NIST-defined allowed values for resource types.

constraints.name: system-identifier-type
constraints.description: Enables an identifier to be formally recognized as being assigned by FedRAMP.

constraints.name: information-type-system
constraints.description: Identifies the system from which the information type was defined.
constraints.remarks: FedRAMP only allows information types defined in NIST SP 800-60v2r1.

constraints.name: security-level
constraints.description: The security objective level as defined by NIST SP 800-60.

constraints.name: system-operational-status
constraints.description: The operational status of the system
constraints.remarks: FedRAMP limits the allowed values from a larger NIST-defined list to only those defined here.
